AnnualLeave.desc: A Sample Enterprise Annual Leave / Vacation application (BETA)
AnnualLeave.note: The purpose of this application is to add some real code to the theory that we outlined in these blog articles and videos for a robust enterprise applicatin architecture. If you haven't read or listened to these then now might be a good time. They explain the core architecture upon which this BETA sample application is based. A Flexible Architecture for Enterprise Mobile Applications? - Part 1, A Flexible Architecture for Enterprise Mobile Applications? - Part 2, A Flexible Project Structure for Enterprise Mobile Applications? - Part 3, VIDEO: A Flexible Architecture for Enterprise Mobile Applications?, VIDEO: A Flexible Project Structure for Enterprise Mobile Applications?

appshot.desc: Programmatically take a screen shot of your Cascades application and open it in the pictures card

App URL.desc: Use App URL to configure an application that has been deployed on BlacKBerry 10

AudioAccessory.desc: Demonstrates how to use the BlackBerry 10 audio jack to transfer data
AudioAccessory.note: The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to use selected BlackBerry 10 Audio APIs in the context of a practical real-world use case which examines how to interface to an external device that is connected via the BlackBerry 10 Audio Jack. This mechanism for connecting accessories is used by a number of vendors in the marketplace as an alternative to Bluetooth Low Energy, WiFi or NFC and this example examines the points you need to consider when taking this approach.

AudioControl.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

AudioLoopBackSample.desc: Demonstrates how to record and playback audio simultaneously (Full Duplex) using the Audio Library APIs as part of the BlackBerry 10 Native SDK

AudioLoopBackSampleToFile.desc: Demonstrates how to record and playback audio simultaneously and designed to easily plug into a VoIP application for encoding/decoding the audio stream

AudioManagerEvents.desc: Demonstrates how to work with audio manager events with a simple example that detects when something is plugged into or removed from the headphone jack

AudioPlayer.desc: Allows you to pick your pre-packaged audio files from a dropdown list

AutomotiveMqttConcept.desc: A demonstration of a concept involving the enterprise, a fleet of vehicles and the IoT protocol MQTT
AutomotiveMqttConcept.note: The purpose of this application is to demonstrate an idea about how data from drivers and vehicles could be collected from sensors via an in-vehicle BlackBerry 10 mobile computer, and sent to the enterprise systems 'in the cloud' for analysis and exploitation.

AutoTrak.desc: Sample BlackBerry 10 Native insurance mobile application to review submitted insurance claims by individuals. Additional project details are contained in the project read me. https://github.com/blackberry/BES10-Cascades/tree/master/AutoTrak/README.md

BtChickenGuardian.desc: A Bluetooth Low Energy Proximity Profile application
BtChickenGuardian.note: The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to develop an application for BlackBerry 10 which works with the Bluetooth Smart (Low Energy) Proximity Profile.

BtHrmPlugin.desc: A Bluetooth Low Energy Heart Rate Plugin for Unity 3D
BtHrmPlugin.note: The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to develop a Unity 3D plugin for BlackBerry 10 that works with the standard Heart Rate Service (overview available here) as specified by the Bluetooth SIG enabling it to interwork with any Bluetooth Smart device that implements this profile.

BtLeFindMe.desc: A Bluetooth Low Energy Lost Keys Finder application
BtLeFindMe.note:
The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to use selected BlackBerry 10 Bluetooth Low Energy APIs in the context of a practical real-world use case.

The use case examines how to interface to a Bluetooth Low Energy device that will, on demand, issue alerts in the form of audible beeps and flashing LEDs. Think of a key fob that that can be activated from your BlackBerry 10 device to allow it to be found again easily.

The application uses the standard Find Me Profile (overview available here) as specified by the Bluetooth SIG enabling it to interwork with any Bluetooth Smart device that implements this profile.

bucketlist.note:

Also shows how to load and save data from a JSON file

childBrowser.note: Improved version to that from WebWorks-Community-Samples

CordovaTemplate.desc: Template for Apache Cordova plugins on BlackBerry 10

CryptoSample.desc: A simple BlackBerry 10 application that demonstrates how to use iBeacon(TM) technology
CryptoSample.note:
The purpose of this application is to demonstrate some of the simpler aspects of the incredibly powerful BlackBerry 10 Security Builder Cryptography Library. Specifically take a look at:

  • Generating a simple random number
  • Calculating Hashes (SHA1, SHA256) and HMAC using a predefined key.
  • Using RSA
    • Creating an RSA public/private key pair
    • Creating a self-signed certficate using this pair of keys showing how to select SHA256 as the hash for the RSA certificate signing rather than the default MD5.
    • Encrypting plaintext and decrypting the resulting ciphertext using this pair of keys

It doesn't discuss AES or other general considerations about the Cryptography Libraries since these are discussed in an earlier GitHub sample application.

.

CscMonitor.desc: A Bluetooth Low Energy application for cyclists
CscMonitor.note: The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to interface to a Bluetooth Low Energy device that supports the Cycling Speed and Cadence Profile as defined by the Bluetooth SIG. This is the type of device that cyclists typically attach to their cycles to allow them to monitor information such as wheel and peddle revolutions and timings.

GattServerSample.desc: Demonstrates how to develop a BlackBerry 10 application that hosts a Bluetooth Low Enery GATT Service.
GattServerSample.note:
The purpose of this project is to demonstrate how to develop an application for BlackBerry 10 which is capable of hosting a Bluetooth Low Enery GATT Service.

The GATT service itself is a simple one that sends a stream of random numbers, one per second, to any client that subscribes to the service's Notifications.

There are two applications in this sample:

  • An application that acts as a GATT Server, and, for convenience;
  • An application that acts as a GATT Client to the GATT server application.

GoodCitizenCascades.desc: The Cascades version of the NDK Sample App named 'Good Citizen'
GoodCitizenCascades.note:
This sample features best practices on how to properly structure the Open GL code and link it with Cascades.

The sample shows how to leverage Actions and the use of NavigatorPanes for multiple panels, as well as how to process touch events and use them to control a 3D scene rendered in OpenGL, using Qt objects and JavaScript

HeartMonitor.desc: A Bluetooth Low Energy Heart Rate Monitor application
HeartMonitor.note:
The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to use selected BlackBerry 10 Bluetooth Low Energy APIs in the context of a practical real-world use case.

The use case examines how to interface to a Bluetooth Low Energy Heart Rate Monitor device in order to acquire and display data from the device. The application uses the standard Heart Rate Service as specificied by the Bluetooth SIG enabling it to interwork with any Bluetooth Smart device that implements this profile.

HelloCamera.desc: Sets up a Cascades foreign window and connects a Camera Viewfinder to it
HelloCamera.note:
HelloCamera is a slender little app showing how to set up a Cascades foreign window and connect the Camera viewfinder to it.

It has functionality for starting and stopping the camera service, changing between cameras and take photos that saves to the camera album

HelloOggVorbis.desc: Basic Ogg file handling using OpenAL and Ogg Vorbis
HelloOggVorbis.note:
This sample is extended from the original cascades cowbell sample in the Cascades-Samples repository.

The objective of this sample is to serve as a tutorial for setting up OpenAL and OggVorbis SDK to play compressed .ogg vorbis sound format. The sample also shows how to decode the regular .wav files without ALUT

HelloVideoCamera.desc: A minimalist Cascades-based video camera app
HelloVideoCamera.note:
HelloVideoCamera is a minimalist Cascades-based video camera app. It illustrates how to set up a Cascades foreign window and connect the Camera viewfinder to it.

HelloVideoCamera has functionality for starting and sotpping the camera, changing between front and back cameras, and recording video files which are saved to the camera roll.

HelloSceneCover.note: HelloSceneCover is a minimalist Cascades-based app. It illustrates how to set up an Application Cover (viewable in Active Frames) for when the application is minimised.

LifeClassic.desc: Simple implementation of classic "GAME OF LIFE". Uses BB10 UI and services (in-app payment). 'Built for BlackBerry' test passed.

ListGroupData.desc: Example of runtime manipulation of GroupDataModel
ListGroupData.note: Provides concrete examples for the manipulation of GroupDataModel from QML, demonstrated through a series of ActionItems.

listdecorators.desc: How to extend the DataModelDecorator or the DataQueryDecorator to enrich the ListView appearance.

LLCPDemo.desc: Shows how to transfer data between two NFC-enabled BlackBerry Smartphones using the NFC Logical Link Control Protocol
LLCPDemo.note:
For Java-based Smartphones. Requires BB7.1

Also see the NFC Wiki page

loader.desc: Load and Unload Controls from the UI at runtime
loader.note: How to use QDeclarativeComponent to extend Cascades

Locale(pb,ext).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to retrieve the locale string

Locale(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to retrieve the locale string

LocaleSample.desc: How to retrieve locale information from the device
LocaleSample.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

Localytics(WebWorks).desc: How to integrate Localytics in app analytics in to a WebWorks app.

locationdiagnostics.desc: Demonstrates the C++ Location APIs in Cascades

LocationPicker(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to select a point on the map and get latitue and longitude

LogExceptionSample.desc: How to handle an exception, log it, and display meaningful data back to the user
LogExceptionSample.warning: Not yet updated to the beta 3 APIs; may move to Cascades-Community-Samples. Temporarily in branch of BlackBerry-core repo

LowLatencyAudio(bb10,ext).desc: WebWorks BB10 extension for low latency audio using Apache Cordova

LowLatencySequencer.desc: Cordova sample for BlackBerry 10 showing usage of LowLatencyAudio plugin.

Macadamian_ExpenseReport.desc: Sample BlackBerry 10 Native expense report application for approving expenses.  Additional project details are contained in the project read me. https://github.com/blackberry/BES10-Cascades/tree/master/ExpenseReport/README.md

Macadamian_SubmitExpense.desc: Sample BlackBerry 10 Native expense report application for submitting expenses.  Additional project details are contained in the project read me. https://github.com/blackberry/BES10-Cascades/tree/master/SubmitExpense/README.md

MailAttachment(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to send an email with an attachment

Maps.desc: How to integrate several mapping services into a BlackBerry WebWorks application
Maps.note: Improved version to that from WebWorks-Community-Samples

mapanimations.desc: Displays a city map with actions to simulate driving along a path, and flight tracking.

mapview.desc: Displays a city map overlayed with three sliders and also shows how to drop push pins on chosen locations

MediaCards.desc: WebWorks sample outlining usage of HTML5 media input and Card Invocation APIs for BlackBerry 10. Presented at BlackBerry Jam Americas lab and includes an incomplete and complete version of the code.

Memory(bb10,ext).desc: WebWorks BB10 extension for getting free memory

messages.desc: How to implement a simple messenger application

MessageBox(bb10,plugin).desc: Port of the Apache Cordova plugin for Dialog Boxes from iOS to BlackBerry 10

MessageList(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to add items to the main mesage list

MoImgur.desc: WebWorks sample showing invocation framework and File API usage, to handle uploads to the Imgur sharing service. Uses Backbone.js for event handling.

Mongoose(bb10,ext).desc: WebWorks BlackBerry 10 extension supplying an embedded Web Server

Mqtt.desc: A Proof of Concept MQTT Shared Library
Mqtt.note:
This project implements a Proof of Concept shared library (libMqtt.so) for BlackBerry 10 that provides an API to some of the main aspects of the MQTT (Message Queuing Telemetry Transport) protocol stack as defined by OASIS.

MQTT provides a lightweight publish/subscribe reliable messaging transport protocol suitable for communication in M2M/IoT (Machine to Machine/Internet of Things) contexts where a small code footprint is required and/or network bandwidth is at a premium.

MyDevice.desc: Demonstrates the BlackBerry 10 APIs that give access to hardware info, battery info, SIM info, display attributes, network interface information and phone line information

NativeAndOpenGLWindows.desc: Combines rendering to Native and OpenGL Windows at the same time

NativeCamera.desc: A simple picture-taking app in C/C++ without Cascades
NativeCamera.note:
The sample shows:
  • how to access the camera
  • how to start the viewfinder and acquire the corresponding viewfinder window handle
  • how to take a photo (non-blocking)
  • how to save a photo to the camera roll
  • how to pass argument data between the main thread and your callback threads
  • how to signal your main thread using user-defined bps events from your callback thread

ndefTagReading.desc: This library allows WebWorks to handle tag reading in pure JavaScript. No extensions are required - tags are delivered through the Invocation Framework.

networking_dwnld_file.desc: A networking sample that shows how to retrieve an XML file and view the raw headers from a remote server while determining network connectivity and the connection interface being used.

networking_ssl.desc: The networking_ssl example shows you how to create a secure SSL connection to a remote server, and send or receive data.

NetworkStatus.desc: How to retrieve the network status of the device
NetworkStatus.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

NFC(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to read supported NDEF record types

NfcChicken.desc: Demonstrate how to use an NFC tag to trigger an action

nfcmacaddress.desc: The NFC MAC address example displays the MAC address of the sender device when receiving data via NFC

nfcreceiver.desc: The NFC Receiver example allows the user to simply read data from NFC tags.

nfcsender.desc: The NFC Sender example allows a user to send content to another NFC enabled device.

nfcshare.desc: The NFC Share example allows a user to exchange content, such as messages or files with another NFC enabled device.

NfcMidlet2.desc: MIDlet that can receive HCI transaction notifications relating NFC card emulation activity
NfcMidlet2.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.0 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcReadNdefSmartTag.desc: Show how to receive NDEF messages from tags and how to process them
NfcReadNdefSmartTag.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcSharing.desc: Sharing Data and Files using NFC and Bluetooth
NfcSharing.note: focusses on those that allow you to share data and files either directly using NFC or using NFC to negotiate a Bluetooth connection which is then used to transfer the data as defined by the NFC Forum Connection Handover standard.

NfcWriteNdefSmartTag.desc: Show how to write various sorts of NDEF messages to NFC tags
NfcWriteNdefSmartTag.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcVirtualTargetFun.desc: Shows the emulation and reading of NFC virtual tags
NfcVirtualTargetFun.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.0 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcSnepResponder.desc: Shows how to transfer NDEF messages between NFC-enabled BlackBerry smartphones using the Simple NDEF Exchange Protocol (SNEP)
NfcSnepResponder.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcToolLite.desc: How to use selected BlackBerry 10 NFC APIs, focusing on the Invocation Framework
NfcToolLite.note: Focuses on those NFC APIs that make use of the Invocation Framework allowing many NFC interactions to take place using QML rather than C/C++

NfcTool.desc: Shows how to use selected BlackBerry 10 NFC APIs
NfcTool.note:
Supports:

  • Reading NDEF tags
  • Writing NDEF tags
  • Transfer vCard via SNEP

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcTransactionHandler.desc: Shows key aspects of an application working in NFC card emulation mode
NfcTransactionHandler.note:
For Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones; requires BB 7.1 or above

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcRaceTime7.desc: Start/stop watch demo app which shows how to integrate NFC Tags into your BlackBerry 7 application. Partner to NfcRaceTimeWay for BlackBerry 10.
NfcRaceTime7.note:
Supports:

  • Reading NDEF tags

Also see the NFC Wiki page

NfcRaceTimeWay.desc: Shows how to integrate NFC Tags and Virtual Tag Emulation into your BlackBerry 10 application. Partner to NfcRaceTime7 for BlackBerry 7.
NfcRaceTimeWay.note:
Supports:

  • Reading NDEF tags
  • Virtual tag emulation

Also see the NFC Wiki page

notebook.desc: How to implement a simple notebook application

NothingButNet.note: See recording of demo at YouTube
NothingButNet.warning:
Location of sample will change within the repository

Does not compile for R6!

notifications.desc: How to send a notification to the u ser and clear if the user has reacted to it

Notification(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to register your app with the custom notification and sound profile

NotificationsHub.desc: WebWorks sample outlining usage of Notification APIs for BlackBerry 10. Presented at BlackBerry Jam Americas lab and includes an incomplete and complete version of the code.

notify.desc: How to use the HTML5 Notification API for a BlackBerry 10 WebWorks App
notify.note: Improved version to that from WebWorks-Community-Samples

nowplaying.desc: How to provide extended information on media being played and control via hardware keys

NutritionTracker.desc: How to make a semi-complex list with rich formatting using jQuery Mobile
NutritionTracker.note: Samples are intended to be included in the jQuery Mobile Cookbook

OpenDataSpace-BBJava.desc: The OpenSource Edition of the java-based client for SSP Europe's SecureDataSpace
OpenDataSpace-BBJava.note:
This is a production-ready application

This project is led by SPP Europe

OpenDataSpace-Cascades.desc: The OpenSource Edition of the Cascades-based client for SSP Europe's SecureDataSpace
OpenDataSpace-Cascades.note:
This is a production-ready application

This project is led by SPP Europe

OpenGLES2-ProgrammingGuide.desc: Port of the samples from the OpenGL ES 2 Programming Guide

OpenStreetMapSample.desc: A simple maps application for android developed with the OSMDroid apis

orientation.desc: How to use QtSensors to find out the current orientation of the device

pageddatamodel.desc: How to create a list view by QML and add items dynamically

PantherUI.desc: The PantherUI is a collection of JavaScript modules and templates for creating responsive UIs for desktop and mobile web apps.

PasswordSample.desc: How to use some of  the Blackberry 10 security APIs
PasswordSample.note: The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how the BlackBerry 10 Security Builder API together with standard features of Qt and Cascades might be used to implement a basic user ID and password based login screen whilst allowing the user credentials to be stored safely locally (as in this case) or remotely using one-way encryption of the password rendering it unusable to those with access to the credentials store.

Payment.desc: Shows how to use the BlackBerry Payment service from a BlackBerry WebWorks App

PaymentService.desc: How to support purchase requests in your application using the Payment Service
PaymentService.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

paymentservice(Cascades).desc: Demonstrates how to use the Payment Service APIs
paymentservice(Cascades).note: Shows how add features like a 'Buy' button and how to display purchase history and subscription terms.  Also shows several layouts and load data into a list using XmlDataModel

PeaksAndValleys.desc: Show how to navigate through a landscape using WebGL
PeaksAndValleys.note:
Sample showcases rendering, textures, lighting, skybox and terrain generation and more

This game runs on the BlackBerry PlayBook and BlackBerry 10 as well as on desktop browsers.

There is no online version yet (unlike TunnelTilt)

Peripheral Disco.desc: Use the peripheral discovery API to detect certain classes of peripheral. Also communicates over USB serial

persistentobjects.desc: How to create/load/write/update a persistent object

photobomber.note: How to use the Cascades multimedia library with the Camera, take a picture, manipulate the image to be grayscale, and add an image over another image

PictureWall.desc: Control a collection of BlackBerry PlayBooks to display one or more images
PictureWall.note:
Uses socket.io on the client and nodeJS on the server

Should run on BB10

pimcalendar.desc: WebWorks sample outlining usage of PIM Calendar APIs for BlackBerry 10. Presented at BlackBerry Jam Americas lab and includes an incomplete and complete version of the code.

pimcontacts.desc: WebWorks sample outlining usage of PIM Contact APIs for BlackBerry 10. Presented at BlackBerry Jam Americas lab and includes an incomplete and complete version of the code.

PjsipDemo.desc: Demonstration of how to build, include and use PJSIP in a Cascades project
PjsipDemo.note:
Currently a very simple application but contains bash scripts for building PJSIP for BB10

Building PJSIP has to be done on Linux/Mac but the resulting files can be overlayed on the SDK of any platform

placepicker.desc: How to use the PlacePicker class to select a place from the favorites list, map lookup or an online search

PlayAudio.desc: How to play an MP3 file
PlayAudio.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

PlayWav.desc: How to play a WAV file
PlayWav.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PlayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

poemmaker.note:
The Poem Maker is a simple application with three lines of text (labels) and a button. Clicking the button will generate a random 'refrigerator' poem

Among others, the application shows how to use JavaScript functions in QML

PreventSleep(bb10,ext).desc: WebWorks BB10 extension to prevent the screen from sleeping

PreventSleep(bb10,plugin).desc: Apache Cordova plugin to prevent the screen from sleeping

Psychic8.desc: Magic 8 Ball® BBM Integration and Shake To Update sample.

PropertyExample.desc: Demonstrates the Qt Property System used to integrate C++ Data with QML

PullDownToRefresh.desc: A standard way to implement pull down to refresh in browser/WebWorks applications in BlackBerry 10 Applications
PullDownToRefresh.note: Improved version to that from WebWorks-Community-Samples

pullmybeard.note:
This sample application illustrates how to set up a very basic touch interaction.

This is illustrated by moving an image in response to a touch event, and animating it back to position when the touch ends

pushCapture.desc: Demonstrates how to write a BlackBerry 10 WebWorks Application that can receive push events
pushCapture.note: Consult the PushService and PushPayload classes from the API reference for useful examples and a full description of how to use the push APIs

pushCaptureBasics.desc: Demonstrates how to write a BlackBerry 10 WebWorks Application that can send and receive push events
pushCaptureBasics.note: Consult the PushService and PushPayload classes from the API reference for useful examples and a full description of how to use the push APIs

pushCollector.desc: How to listen to incoming push requests and display the delivered data
pushCollector.note: PushCollector on 10.2 uses a headless app

quotes.note: Shows how to deal with dynamic data in a list that is stored in a SQL database

repeater.note:
How to use QDeclarativeComponent to add a custom element

Load and unload controls from external QML file or internal component

RestaurantLocator.desc: How to make a semi-complex list with rich formatting using jQuery Mobile
RestaurantLocator.note: Samples are intended to be included in the jQuery Mobile Cookbook

RockPaperScissors.desc: Simple Rock Paper Scissors game using Cascasdes

RotateText.desc: Draw text at any angle using OpenGL 2.0
RotateText.note: The sample shows how to draw text at any angle using OpenGL 2.0 and pure C

routemapinvoker.desc: How to invoke the map application and configure it to show a certain route between two locations

rssnews.desc: How to load JSON and XML data from the network and then visualize it

rundgang.desc: How to set up an email with a list of addresses and attach different types of files

SampleBwsClient(C#).desc: A C# program that uses the BlackBerry Web Services (BWS) for Enterprise Administration APIs

SampleBwsClient(Java).desc: A Java program that uses the BlackBerry Web Services (BWS) for Enterprise Administration APIs

SamplePushClient.desc: Sample GCM push client designed to work with BB10 devices and other Android devices.

scratchpad.desc: How to use QImage and QPainter to prepare a cascades::Image
scratchpad.note: For more details, refer to the companion KB Article

Screen(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to subscribe to srolling events, set title and show/hide virtual keyboard

ScreenDisplay(bb10,ext).desc: BB10 WebWorks Extension for calculating Screen pixel data

Screenshot(bb10,ext).desc: WebWorks BB10 extension for capturing in-app screenshots

ScreenTemplate.desc: Template you can use to set your application to start using the BPS infrastructure
ScreenTemplate.note: There are several branches: 'ndk1' is for PlayBook 1, 'ndk2' is for PLayBook 2, 'master' is for PlayBook 2 and 'next' is for BlackBerry 10

Sencha Touch Sample with BlackBerry 10 L.desc: This sample shows how to develop a Sencha Touch application with the BlackBerry 10 Look and feel

Sencha Touch BFB Boiler Plate Sample.desc: This sample meant to be a starting point for any Sencha Touch developer who wishes to build apps for BlackBerry 10 with the BlackBerry 10 native look and feel

SendMenu(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to expose the Send/Share Menu API

SensorDemo.desc: A collection of pages demonstrating how to retrieve and process data from hardware sensors

Sensors.desc: Using several sensors in a BlackBerry WebWorks application, and displaying data back to user
Sensors.note: Improved version to that from WebWorks-Community-Samples

ServerNotify.desc: Demonstrates how to implement a BlackBerry Enterprise Push client and server application in Cascades.

SetWallpaper.desc: How to set the wallpaper in a BlackBerry 10 device using WebWorks

SFDC-BrewApp.desc: Demonstrates how you can quickly create a Cascades BlackBerry 10 application that integrates with your SalesForce.com instance.

ShakeIt.desc: ShakeIt is an example of a headless application creating a native service.

shareCard.desc: Implementing a Share Target (aka. Share Card) using BlackBerry WebWorks

ShareFile.desc: How to use the Share a File from QML

ShareTargets.desc: Shows how to invoke Share Targets (aka. Share Cards) in BlackBerry WebWorks

SimpleBeaconPlugin.desc: A simple BlackBerry 10 Cordova plugin for accessing Bluetooth Low Enery iBeacon devcie advertisments
SimpleBeaconPlugin.note:
This Bluetooth Smart iBeacon WebWorks Cordova Plugin (SimpleBeaconPlugin) is intended to allow WebWorks applications to monitor and detect devices using the Apple de-facto iBeacon standard.

There is a document in the /documents folder describing the plugin's API from JavaScript.

It comes with a sample WebWorks application in the form of a simple iBeacon Monitor application that uses the Bluetooth iBeacon Plugin to monitor for iBeacons.

SimpleBtLeHrPlugin.desc: A simple BlackBerry 10 WebWorks plugin for accessing Bluetooth Low Enery Heart Rate Monitor Service APIs
SimpleBtLeHrPlugin.note:
This Bluetooth Low Energy ( Smart ) WebWorks/Cordova Plugin is intended to allow WebWorks applications to connect to devices that support the Bluetooth Low Energy Heart Rate monitor profile.

There is a document in the /documents folder describing the plugin's API from JavaScript.

It comes with a sample WebWorks application that uses this API to receive notifications of Heart Rate Measurements from a standard commercial sports heart rate monitor appliance.

SimpleBtSppPlugin.desc: A simple BlackBerry 10 WebWorks plugin for accessing Bluetooth SPP APIs
SimpleBtSppPlugin.note:
This Bluetooth SPP WebWorks Plugin is intended to allow WebWorks applications to connect to devices that uses the Bluetooth SPP (Serial Port Protocol) profile.

There is a document in the /documents folder describing the plugin's API from JavaScript.

It comes with a sample WebWorks application in the form of a simple Chat application that uses SPP to communicate between two BlackBerry 10 devices.

SimpleLocationAPI.desc: Simplified version of the Location API packages for the Java-based BlackBerry Smartphones
SimpleLocationAPI.note: Note the whitespace embedded in the URL!

SimplePushClient.desc: A simplified push client that also integrates with the device notifications and application thumbnail view.

SimplePushServer.desc: A simple push server that runs on BlackBerry 10. Test both sides of push from the same device!

SimplePushTest.desc: Demonstrates how to implement a BlackBerry Enterprise Push WebWorks client and server application.

simplemap.desc: How to display a location on a map control

SimpleXpBeaconPlugin.desc: A simple Cross Platform Cordova plugin for accessing Bluetooth Low Enery iBeacon device advertisments
SimpleXpBeaconPlugin.note:
This Bluetooth Smart iBeacon WebWorks Cordova Plugin (SimpleXpBeaconPlugin) is intended to allow WebWorks applications to monitor and detect devices using the Apple de-facto iBeacon standard.

It supports both:

  • BlackBerry 10, and
  • Android

There is a document in the /documents folder describing the plugin's API from JavaScript.

It comes with a sample WebWorks application in the form of a simple iBeacon Monitor application that uses the Bluetooth iBeacon Plugin to monitor for iBeacons.

SketchPad.desc: Shows how to use touch events and HTML5 Canvas in a BlackBerry WebWorks App

Sleep(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to suspend and enable the backlight

Sleep(pb,ext).desc: WebWorks PlayBook extension to suspend changing the system IdleMode property

SmartSignals.desc: Handle C-Level BPS events in the Cascades Framework
SmartSignals.note: Written using Beta 3. This sample shows how the AbstractBpsEventHandler interface can be extended to receive BPS events without needing to create a separate thread. These events are then made accessible to the QML layer by creating and registering a C++ class, BPSMonitor, so it is known to QML

SmsMessageService.desc: Illustrates sending and receiving user directed SMS messages and how to receive and process delivery receipts
SmsMessageService.note: Illustrates sending and receiving user directed SMS messages and how to receive and process delivery receipts

SmsPortDirected.desc: Illustrates sending and receiving port directed SMS messages
SmsPortDirected.note: Illustrates sending and receiving port directed SMS messages

ScrollableLists.desc: A UI that scrolls horizontally in Cascades

soapxml.desc: How to access a SOAP service using QTSoap, and how to handle the XML Response

socialinvocation.desc: The Social Invocation example demonstrates how to integrate your application with various social networks through the BB10 platform

SocialApp.desc: Shows integration with Social Apps like FaceBook, Twitter, etc

speedwriter.note:
Shows how to create a Custom Control in C++ and add it to a QML document.

Also shows how to monitor changes in a TextField and update a TextArea

SpinnerControl(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to allow a more usable interface with SELECT elements in browser

stampcollector.desc: List with JSON and XML data
stampcollector.note: How to create a simple list and trigger changes in the UI on selection

starshipsettings.desc: Demonstrates how to use persistent store
starshipsettings.note: A simple control panel using QSettings API for persistent store

Storage(bbos,ext).desc: WebWorks Java-based Smartphone extension to make use of the persistent storage on the device

Stumper.MakeThis!.desc: The Post-It solution from Brian Scheirer

Stumper.Carousel.desc: A Carousel (there were two similar challenges)

TabAppMenu.desc: Cascades app menu - Shows correct usage of following Cascades components together: TabbedPane, Tab, Application Menu, Sheet, NavigationPane
TabAppMenu.note:
This is a simple Cascades sample app for developers only.
 The purpose of this app is to demonstrate how to correctly use the following Cascades components together in one app: TabbedPane, Tab, Application Menu, Sheet, NavigationPane.
 This github sample app is also accompanied by the devblog post here: http://devblog.blackberry.com/2013/03/blackberry-10-app-menu/

Template(bb10,plugin).desc: Apache Cordova plugin Template for BlackBerry 10

TestMqtt.note:
The purpose of this application is to help explore the use of MQTT (Message Queuing Telemetry Transport) as defined by OASIS. It makes use of a shared library (libMqtt.so) we've written, as a Proof of Concept, that implements some of the main aspects of the API needed by an MQTT client.

MQTT provides a lightweight publish/subscribe reliable messaging transport protocol suitable for communication in M2M/IoT (Machine to Machine/Internet of Things) contexts where a small code footprint is required and/or network bandwidth is at a premium.

VideoPlayerSample.desc: A simple video player application that uses the MediaPlayer API
VideoPlayerSample.note: VideoPlayerSample is a simple video player application. It uses the new MediaPlayer API and showcases all the fundamentals to make other full fledged video player applications.

WakeMeByBeacon.desc: A simple BlackBerry 10 application that demonstrates how to use iBeacon(TM) technology using a Headless Application
WakeMeByBeacon.note: The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to develop an application for BlackBerry 10 which is capable of running as a Headless application, detecting iBeacons(TM) in the background and notifying the application's user interface component of iBeacon(TM) events. If the user interface component is not running it will be launched via the Hub.

Weather.desc: Shows how to use the HTML5 Database and the GeoLocation APIs

weatherguesser.desc: Uses tabbed and navigation panes and loads data from SQL and nonlocal JSON feeds
weatherguesser.note: Shows how to use NavigationPane and TabbedPane, and how to populate a list using the AsyncDataModel and SqlDataQuery.

Web Launcher(Webworks).desc: A simple web launcher that launches a url into the browser.

WakeMeByBeacon.desc: A simple BlackBerry 10 WebWorks application that demonstrates how to use iBeacon(TM) technology using a Headless Application
WakeMeByBeacon.note: The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to develop a WebWorks application for BlackBerry 10 which is capable of running as a Headless application, detecting iBeacons(TM) in the background and notifying the application's WebWorks user interface component of iBeacon(TM) events. If the user interface component is not running it will be launched via the Hub.

WheresMyBeacon.desc: A simple BlackBerry 10 application that demonstrates how to use iBeacon(TM) technology
WheresMyBeacon.note:
The purpose of this application is to demonstrate how to develop an application for BlackBerry 10 which is capable of decoding the advertisement data sent by an Estimote beacon; and by extension iBeacon(TM)

.
